title: How to Insert a Signature in Word

steps.headline: Go to https://www.docusign.com/solutions/microsoft/word in a web browser.
steps.description: This opens the DocuSign download page for Microsoft Word.

steps.headline: Click Get it Now.
steps.description: It’s the yellow button on the left side of the screen.

steps.headline: Click Add.
steps.description: It’s the green button beside the DocuSign download icon.

steps.headline: Click Trust this add-in.
steps.description: It’s in the column on the right side of the Word window.

steps.headline: Click OK on the blue pop-up window.
Open the document you want to sign.
steps.description: Press Ctrl+O (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd+O (macOS), then double-click the document’s name.

steps.headline: Click the DocuSign tab.
steps.description: It’s in the row of tabs along the top of the screen. This opens the DocuSign panel on the right side of the screen.

steps.headline: Click Sign Document on the DocuSign panel.
Select a sign-in method.
steps.description: If you have a DocuSign account, you can choose that. Otherwise select Log in with Microsoft or Log in with Office 365. The rest of this method assumes you are signing in with your Microsoft account.

steps.headline: Sign in to the selected account.
steps.description: A pop-up will appear.

steps.headline: Scroll to the bottom of the pop-up and click Yes.
steps.description: This brings you back to the document.

steps.headline: Click Go to My DocuSign.
steps.description: It’s in the right panel under “DocuSign for Word.” This brings you to the page where you’ll create your signature.

steps.headline: Type your name and select a font.
steps.description: You’ll see your name appear in different fonts below. To choose a font, click the sample.

steps.headline: Click Create.
steps.description: It’s the blue button near the bottom-left side of the current window. If you aren’t brought back to your Word document, return to it now.

steps.headline: Click Sign Document.
steps.description: It’s at the top-left corner of the screen. It’s under an icon with a pen and sheet of paper on it.

steps.headline: Click Signature.
steps.description: It’s on the left side of the screen. This adds the signature to the bottom of the document. To reposition the signature, click on one of the dotted lines surrounding the signature, and then drag it to another location.

steps.headline: Click Finalize.
steps.description: It’s the yellow button near the bottom-right corner of the window. A pop-up window will appear, prompting you to send the document to someone.

steps.headline: Click No Thanks.
steps.description: This dismisses the window so you can download the signed version of the document to your computer.

steps.headline: Click Download Document.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom of the right panel.

steps.headline: Click OK.
steps.description: The signed document is now saved to your computer.

steps.headline: Go to http://office.live.com/start/Word.aspx in your web browser.
steps.description: You can use any web browser on your computer to access Word Online. If you’re not already signed in to your Microsoft account, click Login with Microsoft Account, then follow the prompts to log in.

steps.headline: Select your document or click Blank document.
Click the Insert toolbar.
steps.description: It’s at the top of the screen.

steps.headline: Click Office Add-Ons.
steps.description: It’s near the top of the screen.

steps.headline: Type DocuSign into the search box and press ↵ Enter.
steps.description: You should now see search results.

steps.headline: Click Add next to “DocuSign for Word.” Once the add-on is installed, you’ll return to your document.
Click Create Account.
steps.description: It’s in the right panel.

steps.headline: Enter your personal information and click Register.
steps.description: A confirmation message will then be sent to your email address.

steps.headline: Click Activate in the confirmation message from DocuSign.
steps.description: You’ll have to log into your email account to find it. This confirms your new DocuSign account.

steps.headline: Create a password for your DocuSign account.
steps.description: The two passwords must match to be accepted. Once the passwords match, click Activate to complete the sign-up process. You will then be brought to DocuSign.

steps.headline: Click Create Your Signature.
steps.description: It’s in the right panel.

steps.headline: Type your name and select a font.
steps.description: You’ll see your name appear in different fonts below. To choose a font, click the sample.

steps.headline: Click Create.
steps.description: It’s the blue button near the bottom-left corner of the highlighted window. Your signature is now ready to use.

steps.headline: Return to the Word document in your web browser.
Click Login.
steps.description: It’s in the right panel.

steps.headline: Enter your email address and click Continue.
Enter your DocuSign password and click Login.
Click Allow.
steps.description: It’s in the right panel.

steps.headline: Click Continue.
steps.description: It’s the yellow button at the top of the screen.

steps.headline: Click Signature.
steps.description: It’s on the left side of the screen. Your signature will now appear on the preview of the Word document in the right panel.

steps.headline: Move your signature to the desired position.
steps.description: To move it, click the outline of the signature and drag it to another location.

steps.headline: Click Finish.
steps.description: It’s the yellow button at the bottom of the screen. The document is now signed.

steps.headline: Click No Thanks.
steps.description: This closes the current window so you can save a copy of the signed document.

steps.headline: Click Download document.
steps.description: It’s in the right panel. Once the file is downloaded, you can double-click it in your computer’s Downloads folder to open it.

text: Word 2016 and 2013 Go to https://www.docusign.com/solutions/microsoft/word in a web browser. This opens the DocuSign download page for Microsoft Word. Click Get it Now. It’s the yellow button on the left side of the screen. Click Add. It’s the green button beside the DocuSign download icon. Click Open in Word.  Click Trust this add-in. It’s in the column on the right side of the Word window. Click OK on the blue pop-up window.  Open the document you want to sign. Press Ctrl+O (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd+O (macOS), then double-click the document’s name. Click the DocuSign tab. It’s in the row of tabs along the top of the screen. This opens the DocuSign panel on the right side of the screen. Click Sign Document on the DocuSign panel.  Select a sign-in method. If you have a DocuSign account, you can choose that. Otherwise select Log in with Microsoft or Log in with Office 365. The rest of this method assumes you are signing in with your Microsoft account. Sign in to the selected account. A pop-up will appear. Scroll to the bottom of the pop-up and click Yes. This brings you back to the document. Click Go to My DocuSign. It’s in the right panel under “DocuSign for Word.” This brings you to the page where you’ll create your signature. Click Create Signature.  Type your name and select a font. You’ll see your name appear in different fonts below. To choose a font, click the sample. Click Create. It’s the blue button near the bottom-left side of the current window. If you aren’t brought back to your Word document, return to it now. Click Sign Document. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen. It’s under an icon with a pen and sheet of paper on it. Click Signature. It’s on the left side of the screen. This adds the signature to the bottom of the document. To reposition the signature, click on one of the dotted lines surrounding the signature, and then drag it to another location. Click Finalize. It’s the yellow button near the bottom-right corner of the window. A pop-up window will appear, prompting you to send the document to someone. Click No Thanks. This dismisses the window so you can download the signed version of the document to your computer. Click Download Document. It’s at the bottom of the right panel. Click OK. The signed document is now saved to your computer. Word Online Go to http://office.live.com/start/Word.aspx in your web browser. You can use any web browser on your computer to access Word Online. If you’re not already signed in to your Microsoft account, click Login with Microsoft Account, then follow the prompts to log in. Select your document or click Blank document.  Click the Insert toolbar. It’s at the top of the screen. Click Office Add-Ons. It’s near the top of the screen. Click Office Store.  Type DocuSign into the search box and press ↵ Enter. You should now see search results. Click Add next to “DocuSign for Word.” Once the add-on is installed, you’ll return to your document.  Click Create Account. It’s in the right panel. Enter your personal information and click Register. A confirmation message will then be sent to your email address. Click Activate in the confirmation message from DocuSign. You’ll have to log into your email account to find it. This confirms your new DocuSign account. Create a password for your DocuSign account. The two passwords must match to be accepted. Once the passwords match, click Activate to complete the sign-up process. You will then be brought to DocuSign. Click Create Your Signature. It’s in the right panel. Type your name and select a font. You’ll see your name appear in different fonts below. To choose a font, click the sample. Click Create. It’s the blue button near the bottom-left corner of the highlighted window. Your signature is now ready to use. Return to the Word document in your web browser.  Click Login. It’s in the right panel. Enter your email address and click Continue.  Enter your DocuSign password and click Login.  Click Allow. It’s in the right panel. Click Continue. It’s the yellow button at the top of the screen. Click Signature. It’s on the left side of the screen. Your signature will now appear on the preview of the Word document in the right panel. Move your signature to the desired position. To move it, click the outline of the signature and drag it to another location. Click Finish. It’s the yellow button at the bottom of the screen. The document is now signed. Click No Thanks. This closes the current window so you can save a copy of the signed document. Click Download document. It’s in the right panel. Once the file is downloaded, you can double-click it in your computer’s Downloads folder to open it.
